body.p: The IPC messages in the following sections are initiated by different managers in order to manage the system.

section.title: CreateAdminCplQReq
section.p: This message is sent from the PCIe Manager to the Admin Command Manager to create the admin completion queue when the host sets the CC.EN bit to ‘1’.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
If set to ‘1’, then interrupts are enabled for this Completion Queue. If cleared to ‘0’, then interrupts are disabled for this Completion Queue.
This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.

This field indicates which interrupt vector to use for this Completion Queue. This corresponds to the MSI-X or multiple message MSI vector. If using single message MSI or pin-based interrupts, then this field shall be cleared to 0h.
Identifier given to the queue being created. This value shall not exceed the value reported in the Number of Queues feature for I/O Completion Queues.
Zero based value specifying the size of the completion queue in entries.
Lower 32 bits of the 64-bit queue base address in host memory.
Upper 32 bits of the 64-bit queue base address in host memory.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: CreateAdminCplQCpl
section.p: In response to receiving a CreateAdminCplQReq IPC message and after performing any associated operations, the Admin Command Manager will send this message to the PCIe Manager.

description.p: An exception occurred while processing the command, the status field contains the appropriate status value.
2h Maximum queue size exceeded. An attempt was made to create an I/O Completion Queue with a number of entries that exceeds the maximum supported by the controller, specified in CAP.MQES.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: CreateAdminSubQReq
section.p: This message is sent from the PCIe Manager to the Admin Command Manager to create the admin submission queue when the host sets the CC.EN bit to ‘1’.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
Specifies if an interrupt should be generated when completions are posted to the specified completion queue.
This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.

This field indicates the identifier of the Completion Queue to utilize for any command completion entries associated with this Submission Queue. The value of 0h (Admin Completion Queue) will not be specified.
Identifier given to the queue being created. This value will not exceed the value reported in the Number of Queues feature for I/O Completion Queues.
Zero based value specifying the size of the completion queue in entries.
Lower 32 bits of the 64-bit queue base address in host memory.
Upper 32 bits of the 64-bit queue base address in host memory.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: CreateAdminSubQCpl
section.p: In response to receiving a CreateAdminSubQReq IPC message and after performing any associated operations, the Admin Command Manager will send this message to the PCIe Manager.

description.p: An exception occurred while processing the command, the status field contains the appropriate status value.
0h Completion Queue Invalid. The Completion Queue identifier specified in the command does not exist.
2h Maximum queue size exceeded. An attempt was made to create an I/O Submission Queue with a number of entries that exceeds the maximum supported by the controller, specified in CAP.MQES.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: DeleteSubQReq
section.p: When the host sets the NVM Express CC.EN bit to ‘0’, the PCIe Manager will determine which queues are affected based on its mode of operation and send this message to the Admin Command Manager.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.
This field indicates the starting range of the Submission Queue(s) to be deleted.
The value of 0h (Admin Submission Queue) shall not be specified.

This field indicates the ending range of the Completion Queue(s) to be deleted. This range is inclusive. If a startCplQueueID of 0 and endCplQueueID of 128 is used, this will delete all 129 Completion Queues. To delete just one queue, the startCplQueueID and endCplQueueID values should be the same.
The value of 0h (Admin Submission Queue) shall not be specified.
This field indicates the reason why the Submission Queue Range is being deleted.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: DeleteSubQCpl
section.p: In response to receiving a DeleteSubQReq IPC message and after performing any associated operations, the Admin Command Manager will send this message to the PCIe Manager.

description.p: An exception occurred while processing the command. The status field contains the appropriate status value.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: QueueMapCreateReq
section.p: Message sent from the Admin Command Manager to all of the Data Managers to create a mapping between a Submission queue and a Completion queue.

description.p: This field specifies the PCIe port that the queue mapping is associated with.
Specifies that this submission/completion queue pair are for administration purposes.
Specifies if an interrupt should be generated when completions are posted to the specified completion queue.
This field specifies the ID of the submission queue engine for which a mapping is being added.
This field specifies the ID of the completion queue engine to which the specified submission queue engine is mapped.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: QueueMapCreateCpl
section.p: Message sent from the Data Manager to the Admin Command Manager in response to a QueueMapCreateReq IPC message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: QueueMapDelReq
section.p: Message sent from the Admin Command Manager to the Data Manager to delete a mapping between a Submission Queue and a Completion Queue.

description.p: This field specifies the PCIe port that the queue mapping is associated with.
This field specifies the ID of the submission queue engine for which the mapping is being deleted.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: QueueMapDelCpl
section.p: Message sent from the Data Manager to the Admin Command Manager in response to a QueueMapDelReq IPC message.

description.p: 1h NVM Express commands were aborted due to the queue deletion request.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: UpdateMemPgSzReq
section.p: Message sent from the PCIe Manager to the Admin Command Manager in response to a change in the NVM Express Controller Configuration Register’s Memory Page Size field.

description.p: This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.
This field indicates the size of the memory page size as (2 ^(12+mps)). Thus the minimum page size is 4KB and the maximum host memory page size is 128MB.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: UpdateMemPgSzCpl
section.p: Message sent from the Admin Command Manager to the PCIe Manager in response to a UpdateMemPgSzReq IPC message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: UpdatePCIHdr
section.p: Messages sent from the PCIe Manager to the Admin Command Manager and then propagated to the Data Managers. IPC messages notify that the PCIe Control header field has changed. The header only affects requests generated by the queues indicated by the inclusive range startQueue and endQueue. This is the same information that can be found in the CAR_SQExPCIECTL and CAR_CQExPCIECTL registers.

description.p: This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.
This is the starting Queue ID range for which the PCIe Control header has changed.
This is the last Queue ID for which the PCIe Control header has changed.
This field contains the Requester ID (RID) header field value used in PCIe requests issued by this interrupt vector.
This field contains the Attribute (Attr) header field value used in PCIe requests issued by this interrupt vector.
This field contains the Address Type (AT) header field value used in PCIe requests issued by this interrupt vector.
This field contains the TLP Processing Hints Present (TH) header field value used in PCIe requests issued by this interrupt vector.
When the TLP Processing Hints Present (TH) bit is set in this register, this field contains the Processing Hints (PH) field used in PCIe requests issued by this interrupt vector.
When the TH bit is cleared, the value of this field is ignored.
When the TLP Processing Hints Present (TH) bit is set in this register, this field contains the Steering Tag (ST) field used in PCIe requests issued by this interrupt vector.
When the TH bit is cleared, the value of this field is ignored.

section.title: NotifyPCIeMgr
section.p: When a CmdReady64 DWORD 16 Status bits 23:16, CmdReady128 DWORD 32 Status Bits 23:16, DmaCpl DWORD 2 Status bits 7:0 are a non-zero value, the receiving manager must notify the PCIe Manager of this occurrence. DWords 1 to 5 are from the NVM Express Specification Get Log Page Command Error Information (Log Identifier 0x01).

description.p: This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.
This field encodes the status of the command.
6h (FatalError) Fatal Error detected. Will set NVME register CSTS.CFS field.
This field encodes the ID of the hardware functional unit that reported the error.
NVMe Error Log Submission Queue ID
This field indicates the Submission Queue Identifier of the command that the error information is associated with.
This field indicates the Command Identifier of the command that the error is associated with.
This field indicates the Status Code that the command completed with.
NVMe Error Log Parameter Error Location

This field indicates the byte and bit of the command parameter that the error is associated with, if applicable. If the parameter spans multiple bytes or bits, then the location indicates the first byte and bit of the parameter.
Bits 7:0 Byte in command that contained the error. Valid values are 0 to 63.
Bits 10:8 Bit in command that contained the error. Valid values are 0 to7.
This field indicates the first LBA that experienced the error condition, if applicable.
This field indicates the namespace that the error is associated with, if applicable.

section.title: NotifyGlobalError
section.p: When a Global Error occurs, a firmware manager may need to be notified that an error occurred. To prevent multiple writers to a register, the Admin Command Manager will send this message to notify the appropriate firmware manager. For example, the PCIe Manager needs to be notified of any PCIe or Host I/F errors and any fatal errors that will prevent the controller from resuming.

description.p: Node ID of the originating global error.
Global error status register value that is reported for the failing node.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: LogUpdate
section.p: This message is used by any manager to add a log entry to the error log. The 64 bytes specified by the logEntry field is added to the error log unchanged.

description.p: This field specifies which log that the log entry should be added to.
If the asyncEvent field is set to ‘1’ this field has the following meaning:
If the asynchEvent field is set to ‘0’ this field has the following meaning:
If set to ‘1’ the value specified in the status field corresponds to an asynchronous event Error Status. If set to ‘0’ the status field corresponds to a generic error status.
Entry entry to be appended to the error log page.

section.title: FwUpdtReq
section.p: This message is used to perform firmware activate and firmware upload.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
Number to be stored or activated.
0h Store firmware to the slot specified in fwSlot field without activation.
1h Store firmware to the slot specified in fwSlot field and activate the firmware.
2h Activate firmware specified in fwSlot field.
Firmware Update Section ID in DDR (one per PCIe port) from which update is done
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: FwUpdtCpl
section.p: This message is sent in response to a FwUpdtReq message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: SetIntrVecReq
section.p: A message sent from the Admin Manager to the PCIe Command Manager to update the Interrupt IMVXCTL setting.

description.p: This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.
This field specifies set interrupt vector type.
Indicates whether to enable/disable the interrupt vector
Interrupt vector number that needs to update coalescing setting.

Specifies the recommended maximum time in 100 microsecond Increments that a controller may delay an interrupt due to interrupt coalescing. A value of 0h corresponds to no delay (that is, disabling this capability).
Specifies the desired minimum number of completion queue entries to aggregate per interrupt vector before signaling an interrupt to the host.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: SetIntrVecCpl
section.p: Message sent from the Admin Command Managers to the PCIe manager in response to the SetIntrVecReq message.

description.p: Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: WriteSuperBlkReq
section.p: This message is sent to the Control Manager to write the superblock data to flash.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: WriteSuperBlkCpl
section.p: This message is sent in response to a WriteSuperBlkReq message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: MemAllocReq
section.p: This message is used to send a memory allocation request to the Control Manger. Memory may be allocated from DDR or BRAM as determined by the memType field.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
Number of memory lines to be allocated. Each memory line consists of 64 bytes.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: MemAllocCpl
section.p: This message is sent in response to a MemAllocReq message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: PowerCpl
section.p: Message sent to the control manager in response to the PowerReq message.

description.p: Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: SelfTestReq
section.p: This message may be issued to different managers to request they perform a self-test procedure.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: SelfTestCpl
section.p: This message is sent in response to a SelfTestReq message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: CriticalWarning
section.p: This message is sent to the Admin Command Manager to update the state of the SMART Critical Warnings.

description.p: This field indicates critical warnings for the state of the controller. Each bit corresponds to a critical warning type; multiple bits may be set. The bits in this field are assigned as follows:
0 - If set to ‘1’ then the available spare space has fallen below the threshold.
1 - If set to ‘1’, then the temperature has exceeded a critical threshold.
2 - If set to ‘1’, then the device reliability has been degraded due to significant media related errors or any internal error that degrades device reliability.
3 - If set to ‘1’, then the media has been placed in read-only mode.
4 - If set to ‘1’, then the volatile memory backup device has failed. This field is only valid if the controller has a volatile memory backup solution.

section.title: TemperatureUpdate
section.p: This message may be sent to any manager in order to inform it of the current temperature of the system.

description.p: Temperature of the device, including NVM, in degrees Kelvin.

section.title: MediaError
section.p: This message is sent to the Admin Command Manager in order to update the SMART Media Errors counter.

description.p: The number of media errors being reported by this message.

section.title: DebugMediaError
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Command Manager to request that the destination manager send a MediaError message back to the Admin Manager with information specified in this message.

description.p: Specifies the value in DWORD0 of MediaError message needed by the Admin Manager.

section.title: DebugCriticalWarning
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Manager to request that the destination manager send a CriticalWarning message back to the Admin Manager with information specified in this message.

description.p: Specifies the value in DWORD0 of Critical Warning message needed by the Admin Manager.

section.title: DebugLogUpdate
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Manager to request that the destination manager send a LogUpdate message back to the Admin Manager with information specified in this message.

description.p: Specifies the value in DWORD’s of LogUpdate message needed by the Admin Manager.

section.title: DebugGeneric
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Manager to request that the destination manager send a message back to the Admin Manager with information specified in this message.

description.p: Number of DWord useful in Debug Information
Specifies the value in DWORD’s of debugging message needed by the Admin Manager.

section.title: ResetReq
section.p: When the host sets the NVM Express CC.EN bit to ‘0’ or performs a Fundamental, Hot, or Functional Level Reset, the PCIe Manager will determine which queues are affected based on its mode of operation and send this message to the Admin Command Manager.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
This field contains the PCIe port on which the request was received.
This field indicates the reason for the reset.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: ResetCpl
section.p: In response to receiving a ResetReq IPC message and after performing any associated operations the Admin Command Manager will send this message to the PCIe Manager.

description.p: An exception occurred while processing the command, the status field contains the appropriate status value.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: ReloadFwReq
section.p: This message is sent by the PCIe Manager to the Control Manager to initiate a Firmware Reload due to a reset request from the Host.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
This code determines whether what managers firmware to reload.
1h - Reload firmware for all managers except PCIe Manager.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: ReloadFwCpl
section.p: This message is sent by the Control Manager in response to a ReloadFwReq.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: ROMImageEnableReq
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Command Manager to the PCIe Manager when it receives the ROM Image Enable NVM Express vendor specific command from the host.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
This field indicates whether to enable or disable the option ROM image.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: ROMImageEnableCpl
section.p: This message is sent from the PCIe Manager to the Admin Command Manager in response to a ROMImageEnableReq IPC message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: FlashBadBlockReq
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Command Manager to upload the flash bad block to the controller memory.

description.p: Starting instance of the flash bad block to be transferred. ‘0’ means beginning of the flash bad block entry list.
Buffer address lower 32-bit. Flash bad block information should be transferred to controller memory buffer.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: FlashBadBlockCpl
section.p: This message is sent to the Admin Command Manager in response to a FlashBadBlockReq IPC message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: StatisticsInfoReq
section.p: This message is sent from the Admin Command Manager to upload the statistics information to the controller memory.

description.p: Data type of the flash statistics information.
06h: Garbage Collection Valid Data Frame Count
Data type of the global statistics information.
02h: Pending IPC: Messages sent and Messages Queued
Buffer address lower 32-bit. Flash bad block information should be transferred to controller memory buffer.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.

section.title: StatisticsInfoCpl
section.p: This message is sent to the Admin Command Manager in response to a StatisticsInfoReq IPC message.

description.p: Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: SetBadBlkReq
section.p: This message is used by the bad block download request from the host.

description.p: ID of the outbound IPC port that should be used when sending the completion to this message.
Address of the flash block that is bad.
Opaque tag information to be returned when sending the completion to this message.
Opaque tag information from the request message.

section.title: NssrReq
section.p: This message is sent to the Control Manager by the PCIe Manager in order to initiate an NVM Subsystem Reset. Since issuing this request causes an NVM Subsystem Reset, there is no associated completion message.
